name: authenticate_service
description: Authenticates a specified service, enabling access to its protected API functions. The service must be registered in the system before it can be authenticated.

service_name.description: The unique identifier of the service to authenticate. Must be a valid service name that exists in the system's service registry.

name: deauthenticate_service
description: Removes authentication credentials for a specified service, revoking access to its protected API functions. The service will need to be re-authenticated before accessing protected resources.

service_name.description: The unique identifier of the service to deauthenticate. Must be a currently authenticated service.

name: is_service_authenticated
description: Checks the current authentication status of a specified service. Returns a boolean indicating whether the service has valid authentication credentials.

service_name.description: The unique identifier of the service whose authentication status should be checked.

name: list_authenticated_services
description: Retrieves a comprehensive list of all services that currently have valid authentication credentials. Returns service names along with their authentication timestamps.

name: reset_all_authentication
description: Performs a complete reset of the authentication system, removing all authentication credentials for every service. This operation requires confirmation and cannot be undone.

name: create_authenticated_function
description: Creates a wrapper function that enforces authentication requirements before executing the original function. The wrapper automatically checks authentication status and blocks execution if the service is not authenticated.

service_name.description: The name of the service that must be authenticated before the wrapped function can be executed.

func.description: The original function object to be wrapped with authentication requirements. This function will only execute if the specified service is authenticated.
